titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Nelson Parker Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:56

did.unittitle: William Nelson Parker papers

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings, course materials, and printed material documenting the life and career of economist William N. Parker.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Papers are arranged in one section, Inventory, and alphabetically by subject. Four additions maintain original arrangement where noted.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Correspondence in boxes 15-18 of Accession 2001-M-033 is unprocessed and in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu requesting specific box numbers in order to initiate the review process, which may take several weeks.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Nelson Parker Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of William N. Parker, 1992-1995; gift of Jarrett Parker, 2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William Nelson Parker was born in Columbus, Ohio, on June 14, 1919. He received his A.B. from Harvard in 1939, his M.A. in 1941, and his Ph.D. in 1951. Parker was an assistant professor of economics at Williams College from 1951 to 1956, and an associate professor, then professor of economics at the University of North Carolina from 1956 to 1962. He was a professor of economics at Yale from 1962 to 1989. Parker died on April 29, 2000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, subject files, writings, course materials, and printed material documenting the life and career of economist William N. Parker.

did.unittitle: Inventory

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These papers were received as two alphabetically arranged runs of correspondence and printed material. The first run spans primarily the 1960s and 1970s; the second run covers the mid to late 1980s. Some overlap of dates does occur. Two folders of material relating to the reorganization of the School of Organization and Management have been added to the second run.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addition inventory by Carol King 1993 Jul
Received from: William N. Parker, 1993 Jun 10
The sequence in which the materials are presently arranged is identical to that in which they were received. Under this numbering system, folder numbers 139-200 and 331-368 have not been used.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Correspondence in boxes 15-18 is unprocessed and in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu requesting specific box numbers in order to initiate the review process, which may take several weeks.
